newsitem.title: USA: Regulators hold up Bell Atlantic merger- WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Regulators hold up Bell Atlantic merger- WSJ.

text.p: The $23 billion merger between Bell Atlantic and NYNEX Corp is being held up by federal regulators who are pressing the companies to take steps to open their local telephone markets to competition, The Wall Street Journal said.

In Tuesday's electronic edition, the paper cited "people in industry and government" who said staff lawyers at the Federal Communications Commission had been negotiating conditions in recent days with lawyers for the companies.
The agency lawyers were acting with approval of FCC chairman Reed Hunt, the story said.
The Justice Department cleared the deal in April.
